        This poc involves concealing the visibility of the autofill function upon input click, similar to <span class="line"><!---->This poc involves concealing the visibility of the autofill function upon input click, similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1358647<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1358647" title="Security: Bypass the Protection of input fields cache (Autofill) 1108181"><!---->crbug.com/1358647<!----></a>. Then, by pressing the down arrow key, the hidden autofill pop-up is activated, and pressing enter feeds the information. This process can also be performed by simultaneously pressing the down arrow and enter keys, which completely hides the activation of the autofill from the victim.<span class="line"><!---->. Then, by pressing the down arrow key, the hidden autofill pop-up is activated, and pressing enter feeds the information. This process can also be performed by simultaneously pressing the down arrow and enter keys, which completely hides the activation of the autofill from the victim.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Isn't hiding the autofill itself a vulnerability? Even when a 500ms threshold between keystrokes is applied, an attacker could create an engaging game that requires the user to press the arrow down and enter keys with 500ms. <span class="line"><!---->Isn't hiding the autofill itself a vulnerability?         When the victim clicks on "Click to play," the Autofill popup is already active, but it is hidden from the victim's browser. The keyboard stroke is only used to select the address from the selection and enter it.<span class="line"><!---->When the victim clicks on "Click to play," the Autofill popup is already active, but it is hidden from the victim's browser.         I am using a resolution of 1920x1080. Maybe the popup is still visible when clicked because of a higher resolution. To fix this, you could increase the value from 1000 to something like 5000. This will hide it away. You can find this in the last part of the code.<span class="line"><!---->I am using a resolution of 1920x1080. Maybe the popup is still visible when clicked because of a higher resolution. To fix this, you could increase the value from 1000 to something like 5000. This will hide it away. You can find this in the last part of the code.<!----></span><br><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><br>            // Move field away from mouse to hide the autofill popup<span class="line"><!---->            // Move field away from mouse to hide the autofill popup<!----></span><br>            var inputX = e.clientX + 1000;<span class="line"><!---->            var inputX = e.clientX + 1000;<!----></span><br>            var inputY = e.clientY + 1000;<span class="line"><!---->            var inputY = e.clientY + 1000;<!----></span><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yes, Arrow launches the popup again, and Enter confirms the selection. This can be done easily by tricking the user to use the two key shortcut of Arrow and Enter together while the popup is active and hidden away.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, Arrow launches the popup again, and Enter confirms the selection. This can be done easily by tricking the user to use the two key shortcut of Arrow and Enter together while the popup is active and hidden away.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yes, your assumption is correct. We lure the victim into thinking that they need to press both buttons.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, your assumption is correct. Are you certain that you are changing the same code? Additionally, please note that I am using Windows, so it's possible that the behavior (where the popup moves hidden) is specific to Windows and may not be the same on other operating systems.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure why you are not getting the same results as I am. Are you certain that you are changing the same code? Additionally, please note that I am using Windows, so it's possible that the behavior (where the popup moves hidden) is specific to Windows and may not be the same on other operating systems.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        I can't reproduce any moving of the Autofill popup on Windows either.<span class="line"><!---->I can't reproduce any moving of the Autofill popup on Windows either.<!----></span><br><br>If, like you confirmed if I understood correctly, the attack is based on a very fast sequence of "arrow down – enter", I don't understand why moving the <input> and the Autofill popup is relevant to the attack. The "arrow down – enter" issue is covered by the feature AutofillPopupUseThresholdForKeyboardAndMobileAccept (<span class="line"><!---->If, like you confirmed if I understood correctly, the attack is based on a very fast sequence of "arrow down – enter", I don't understand why moving the &lt;input&gt; and the Autofill popup is relevant to the attack. The "arrow down – enter" issue is covered by the feature AutofillPopupUseThresholdForKeyboardAndMobileAccept (<!----></span>issue 1418364<span class="line"><!---->issue 1418364<!----></span>).<span class="line"><!---->).<!----></span><br><br>My understanding of the initial report was that when you move the <input>, the Autofill popup moves along. I don't see that in your video though.<span class="line"><!---->My understanding of the initial report was that when you move the &lt;input&gt;, the Autofill popup moves along. I don't see that in your video though.<!----></span><br><br>The position of the popup is determined in by the RectF parameter of AutofillManager::OnAskForValuesToFill() and are passed to the UI. I don't see any way how moving the DOM element would update the popup's position afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->The position of the popup is determined in by the RectF parameter of AutofillManager::OnAskForValuesToFill() and are passed to the UI. I don't see any way how moving the DOM element would update the popup's position afterwards.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }

          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;

          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>

        <slot></slot>
      </label>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;

          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;

          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {

            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

      <form>
        
      <div class="select-container">
        <i class="material-icons" role="presentation">arrow_drop_down</i>
        <select id="can" name="can" aria-label="Search scope">
          <optgroup label="Search within">
            <option value="1" selected="">All issues</option>
            <option value="2">Open issues</option>
            <option value="3">Open and owned by me</option>
            <option value="4">Open and reported by me</option>
            <option value="5">Open and starred by me</option>
            <option value="8">Open with comment by me</option>
            <option value="6">New issues</option>
            <option value="7">Issues to verify</option>
          </optgroup>
          <optgroup label="Project queries" hidden="">

              Manage project queries...
            </option>
          </optgroup>

              Manage my saved queries...
            </option>
          </optgroup>
        </select>
      </div>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This vulnerability is similar to <span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability is similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1240472<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1240472" title="Security: Page can cause autofill prompt to render under cursor in order to bypass mouse movement/keyboard input requirements for autofill"><!---->crbug.com/1240472<!----></a> . An attacker could use it to steal your private information by hiding the autofill field somewhere you can't see it, and then tricking you into pressing arrow down and enter together to start what seems like an innocent game. They could then secretly take your sensitive data. It's important to make sure security measures are strong enough to stop these kinds of attacks.<span class="line"><!----> . An attacker could use it to steal your private information by hiding the autofill field somewhere you can't see it, and then tricking you into pressing arrow down and enter together to start what seems like an innocent game. They could then secretly take your sensitive data. It's important to make sure security measures are strong enough to stop these kinds of attacks.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable) <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable) <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download the file poc.html to a folder<span class="line"><!---->1. Download the file poc.html to a folder<!----></span><br>2. Start a Python server on the same folder by running the command `python -m http.server 8080`.<span class="line"><!---->2. Start a Python server on the same folder by running the command `python -m http.server 8080`.<!----></span><br>3. Open the Chrome browser and navigate to the server at `<span class="line"><!---->3. Open the Chrome browser and navigate to the server at `<!----></span>http://{YOUR-SERVER-IP}:8080/poc.html`<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://{YOUR-SERVER-IP}:8080/poc.html`"><!---->http://{YOUR-SERVER-IP}:8080/poc.html`<!----></a> to Begin testing.<span class="line"><!----> to Begin testing.<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This poc involves concealing the visibility of the autofill function upon input click, similar to <span class="line"><!---->This poc involves concealing the visibility of the autofill function upon input click, similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1358647<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1358647" title="Security: Bypass the Protection of input fields cache (Autofill) 1108181"><!---->crbug.com/1358647<!----></a>. Then, by pressing the down arrow key, the hidden autofill pop-up is activated, and pressing enter feeds the information. This process can also be performed by simultaneously pressing the down arrow and enter keys, which completely hides the activation of the autofill from the victim.<span class="line"><!---->. Then, by pressing the down arrow key, the hidden autofill pop-up is activated, and pressing enter feeds the information. This process can also be performed by simultaneously pressing the down arrow and enter keys, which completely hides the activation of the autofill from the victim.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        When the victim clicks on "Click to play," the Autofill popup is already active, but it is hidden from the victim's browser. The keyboard stroke is only used to select the address from the selection and enter it.<span class="line"><!---->When the victim clicks on "Click to play," the Autofill popup is already active, but it is hidden from the victim's browser. The keyboard stroke is only used to select the address from the selection and enter it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I am using a resolution of 1920x1080. Maybe the popup is still visible when clicked because of a higher resolution. To fix this, you could increase the value from 1000 to something like 5000. This will hide it away. You can find this in the last part of the code.<span class="line"><!---->I am using a resolution of 1920x1080. Maybe the popup is still visible when clicked because of a higher resolution. To fix this, you could increase the value from 1000 to something like 5000. This will hide it away. You can find this in the last part of the code.<!----></span><br><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><br>            // Move field away from mouse to hide the autofill popup<span class="line"><!---->            // Move field away from mouse to hide the autofill popup<!----></span><br>            var inputX = e.clientX + 1000;<span class="line"><!---->            var inputX = e.clientX + 1000;<!----></span><br>            var inputY = e.clientY + 1000;<span class="line"><!---->            var inputY = e.clientY + 1000;<!----></span><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I can't reproduce any moving of the Autofill popup on Windows either.<span class="line"><!---->I can't reproduce any moving of the Autofill popup on Windows either.<!----></span><br><br>If, like you confirmed if I understood correctly, the attack is based on a very fast sequence of "arrow down – enter", I don't understand why moving the <input> and the Autofill popup is relevant to the attack. The "arrow down – enter" issue is covered by the feature AutofillPopupUseThresholdForKeyboardAndMobileAccept (<span class="line"><!---->If, like you confirmed if I understood correctly, the attack is based on a very fast sequence of "arrow down – enter", I don't understand why moving the &lt;input&gt; and the Autofill popup is relevant to the attack. The "arrow down – enter" issue is covered by the feature AutofillPopupUseThresholdForKeyboardAndMobileAccept (<!----></span>issue 1418364<span class="line"><!---->issue 1418364<!----></span>).<span class="line"><!---->).<!----></span><br><br>My understanding of the initial report was that when you move the <input>, the Autofill popup moves along. I don't see that in your video though.<span class="line"><!---->My understanding of the initial report was that when you move the &lt;input&gt;, the Autofill popup moves along. I don't see that in your video though.<!----></span><br><br>The position of the popup is determined in by the RectF parameter of AutofillManager::OnAskForValuesToFill() and are passed to the UI. I don't see any way how moving the DOM element would update the popup's position afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->The position of the popup is determined in by the RectF parameter of AutofillManager::OnAskForValuesToFill() and are passed to the UI. I don't see any way how moving the DOM element would update the popup's position afterwards.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This vulnerability is similar to <span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability is similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1240472<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1240472" title="Security: Page can cause autofill prompt to render under cursor in order to bypass mouse movement/keyboard input requirements for autofill"><!---->crbug.com/1240472<!----></a> . An attacker could use it to steal your private information by hiding the autofill field somewhere you can't see it, and then tricking you into pressing arrow down and enter together to start what seems like an innocent game. They could then secretly take your sensitive data. It's important to make sure security measures are strong enough to stop these kinds of attacks.<span class="line"><!----> . An attacker could use it to steal your private information by hiding the autofill field somewhere you can't see it, and then tricking you into pressing arrow down and enter together to start what seems like an innocent game. They could then secretly take your sensitive data. It's important to make sure security measures are strong enough to stop these kinds of attacks.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable) <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable) <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download the file poc.html to a folder<span class="line"><!---->1. Download the file poc.html to a folder<!----></span><br>2. Start a Python server on the same folder by running the command `python -m http.server 8080`.<span class="line"><!---->2. Start a Python server on the same folder by running the command `python -m http.server 8080`.<!----></span><br>3. Open the Chrome browser and navigate to the server at `<span class="line"><!---->3. Open the Chrome browser and navigate to the server at `<!----></span>http://{YOUR-SERVER-IP}:8080/poc.html`<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://{YOUR-SERVER-IP}:8080/poc.html`"><!---->http://{YOUR-SERVER-IP}:8080/poc.html`<!----></a> to Begin testing.<span class="line"><!----> to Begin testing.<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
          
      
        
          
          poc.html<b><!---->poc.html<!----></b>
          
        <div class="filename">
          
          <b><!---->poc.html<!----></b>
          
        </div>

        This poc involves concealing the visibility of the autofill function upon input click, similar to <span class="line"><!---->This poc involves concealing the visibility of the autofill function upon input click, similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1358647<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1358647" title="Security: Bypass the Protection of input fields cache (Autofill) 1108181"><!---->crbug.com/1358647<!----></a>. Then, by pressing the down arrow key, the hidden autofill pop-up is activated, and pressing enter feeds the information. This process can also be performed by simultaneously pressing the down arrow and enter keys, which completely hides the activation of the autofill from the victim.<span class="line"><!---->. Then, by pressing the down arrow key, the hidden autofill pop-up is activated, and pressing enter feeds the information. This process can also be performed by simultaneously pressing the down arrow and enter keys, which completely hides the activation of the autofill from the victim.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Isn't hiding the autofill itself a vulnerability? Even when a 500ms threshold between keystrokes is applied, an attacker could create an engaging game that requires the user to press the arrow down and enter keys with 500ms. <span class="line"><!---->Isn't hiding the autofill itself a vulnerability?         I am using a resolution of 1920x1080. Maybe the popup is still visible when clicked because of a higher resolution. To fix this, you could increase the value from 1000 to something like 5000. This will hide it away. You can find this in the last part of the code.<span class="line"><!---->I am using a resolution of 1920x1080. Maybe the popup is still visible when clicked because of a higher resolution. To fix this, you could increase the value from 1000 to something like 5000. This will hide it away. You can find this in the last part of the code.<!----></span><br><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><br>            // Move field away from mouse to hide the autofill popup<span class="line"><!---->            // Move field away from mouse to hide the autofill popup<!----></span><br>            var inputX = e.clientX + 1000;<span class="line"><!---->            var inputX = e.clientX + 1000;<!----></span><br>            var inputY = e.clientY + 1000;<span class="line"><!---->            var inputY = e.clientY + 1000;<!----></span><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yes, Arrow launches the popup again, and Enter confirms the selection. This can be done easily by tricking the user to use the two key shortcut of Arrow and Enter together while the popup is active and hidden away.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, Arrow launches the popup again, and Enter confirms the selection. Are you certain that you are changing the same code? Additionally, please note that I am using Windows, so it's possible that the behavior (where the popup moves hidden) is specific to Windows and may not be the same on other operating systems.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        I can't reproduce any moving of the Autofill popup on Windows either.<span class="line"><!---->I can't reproduce any moving of the Autofill popup on Windows either.<!----></span><br><br>If, like you confirmed if I understood correctly, the attack is based on a very fast sequence of "arrow down – enter", I don't understand why moving the <input> and the Autofill popup is relevant to the attack. The "arrow down – enter" issue is covered by the feature AutofillPopupUseThresholdForKeyboardAndMobileAccept (<span class="line"><!---->If, like you confirmed if I understood correctly, the attack is based on a very fast sequence of "arrow down – enter", I don't understand why moving the &lt;input&gt; and the Autofill popup is relevant to the attack. The "arrow down – enter" issue is covered by the feature AutofillPopupUseThresholdForKeyboardAndMobileAccept (<!----></span>issue 1418364<span class="line"><!---->issue 1418364<!----></span>).<span class="line"><!---->).<!----></span><br><br>My understanding of the initial report was that when you move the <input>, the Autofill popup moves along. I don't see that in your video though.<span class="line"><!---->My understanding of the initial report was that when you move the &lt;input&gt;, the Autofill popup moves along. I don't see that in your video though.<!----></span><br><br>The position of the popup is determined in by the RectF parameter of AutofillManager::OnAskForValuesToFill() and are passed to the UI. I don't see any way how moving the DOM element would update the popup's position afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->The position of the popup is determined in by the RectF parameter of AutofillManager::OnAskForValuesToFill() and are passed to the UI. I don't see any way how moving the DOM element would update the popup's position afterwards.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;

          white-space: nowrap;

          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

          color: var(--chops-link-color);

          z-index: 999;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

          <input type="text" name="newHotlistName">

      <br>

            Discard
          </chops-button>
          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This vulnerability is similar to <span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability is similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1240472<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1240472" title="Security: Page can cause autofill prompt to render under cursor in order to bypass mouse movement/keyboard input requirements for autofill"><!---->crbug.com/1240472<!----></a> . An attacker could use it to steal your private information by hiding the autofill field somewhere you can't see it, and then tricking you into pressing arrow down and enter together to start what seems like an innocent game. They could then secretly take your sensitive data. It's important to make sure security measures are strong enough to stop these kinds of attacks.<span class="line"><!----> . An attacker could use it to steal your private information by hiding the autofill field somewhere you can't see it, and then tricking you into pressing arrow down and enter together to start what seems like an innocent game. They could then secretly take your sensitive data. It's important to make sure security measures are strong enough to stop these kinds of attacks.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable) <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable) <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download the file poc.html to a folder<span class="line"><!---->1. Download the file poc.html to a folder<!----></span><br>2. Start a Python server on the same folder by running the command `python -m http.server 8080`.<span class="line"><!---->2. Start a Python server on the same folder by running the command `python -m http.server 8080`.<!----></span><br>3. Open the Chrome browser and navigate to the server at `<span class="line"><!---->3. Open the Chrome browser and navigate to the server at `<!----></span>http://{YOUR-SERVER-IP}:8080/poc.html`<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://{YOUR-SERVER-IP}:8080/poc.html`"><!---->http://{YOUR-SERVER-IP}:8080/poc.html`<!----></a> to Begin testing.<span class="line"><!----> to Begin testing.<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This poc involves concealing the visibility of the autofill function upon input click, similar to <span class="line"><!---->This poc involves concealing the visibility of the autofill function upon input click, similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1358647<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1358647" title="Security: Bypass the Protection of input fields cache (Autofill) 1108181"><!---->crbug.com/1358647<!----></a>. Then, by pressing the down arrow key, the hidden autofill pop-up is activated, and pressing enter feeds the information. This process can also be performed by simultaneously pressing the down arrow and enter keys, which completely hides the activation of the autofill from the victim.<span class="line"><!---->. Then, by pressing the down arrow key, the hidden autofill pop-up is activated, and pressing enter feeds the information. This process can also be performed by simultaneously pressing the down arrow and enter keys, which completely hides the activation of the autofill from the victim.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I am using a resolution of 1920x1080. Maybe the popup is still visible when clicked because of a higher resolution. To fix this, you could increase the value from 1000 to something like 5000. This will hide it away. You can find this in the last part of the code.<span class="line"><!---->I am using a resolution of 1920x1080. Maybe the popup is still visible when clicked because of a higher resolution. To fix this, you could increase the value from 1000 to something like 5000. This will hide it away. You can find this in the last part of the code.<!----></span><br><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><br>            // Move field away from mouse to hide the autofill popup<span class="line"><!---->            // Move field away from mouse to hide the autofill popup<!----></span><br>            var inputX = e.clientX + 1000;<span class="line"><!---->            var inputX = e.clientX + 1000;<!----></span><br>            var inputY = e.clientY + 1000;<span class="line"><!---->            var inputY = e.clientY + 1000;<!----></span><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I can't reproduce any moving of the Autofill popup on Windows either.<span class="line"><!---->I can't reproduce any moving of the Autofill popup on Windows either.<!----></span><br><br>If, like you confirmed if I understood correctly, the attack is based on a very fast sequence of "arrow down – enter", I don't understand why moving the <input> and the Autofill popup is relevant to the attack. The "arrow down – enter" issue is covered by the feature AutofillPopupUseThresholdForKeyboardAndMobileAccept (<span class="line"><!---->If, like you confirmed if I understood correctly, the attack is based on a very fast sequence of "arrow down – enter", I don't understand why moving the &lt;input&gt; and the Autofill popup is relevant to the attack. The "arrow down – enter" issue is covered by the feature AutofillPopupUseThresholdForKeyboardAndMobileAccept (<!----></span>issue 1418364<span class="line"><!---->issue 1418364<!----></span>).<span class="line"><!---->).<!----></span><br><br>My understanding of the initial report was that when you move the <input>, the Autofill popup moves along. I don't see that in your video though.<span class="line"><!---->My understanding of the initial report was that when you move the &lt;input&gt;, the Autofill popup moves along. I don't see that in your video though.<!----></span><br><br>The position of the popup is determined in by the RectF parameter of AutofillManager::OnAskForValuesToFill() and are passed to the UI. I don't see any way how moving the DOM element would update the popup's position afterwards.<span class="line"><!---->The position of the popup is determined in by the RectF parameter of AutofillManager::OnAskForValuesToFill() and are passed to the UI. I don't see any way how moving the DOM element would update the popup's position afterwards.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

            Issue 1427464: Security: Obfuscated Autofill Field Exploit in Chromium
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1427464: Security: Obfuscated Autofill Field Exploit in Chromium
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      fazim...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/584297913" title="fazim...@gmail.com"><!---->fazim...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      fazim...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->fazim...@gmail.com<!----></span>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This vulnerability is similar to <span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability is similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1240472<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1240472" title="Security: Page can cause autofill prompt to render under cursor in order to bypass mouse movement/keyboard input requirements for autofill"><!---->crbug.com/1240472<!----></a> . An attacker could use it to steal your private information by hiding the autofill field somewhere you can't see it, and then tricking you into pressing arrow down and enter together to start what seems like an innocent game. They could then secretly take your sensitive data. It's important to make sure security measures are strong enough to stop these kinds of attacks.<span class="line"><!----> . An attacker could use it to steal your private information by hiding the autofill field somewhere you can't see it, and then tricking you into pressing arrow down and enter together to start what seems like an innocent game. They could then secretly take your sensitive data. It's important to make sure security measures are strong enough to stop these kinds of attacks.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable) <span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable) <!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Download the file poc.html to a folder<span class="line"><!---->1. Download the file poc.html to a folder<!----></span><br>2. Start a Python server on the same folder by running the command `python -m http.server 8080`.<span class="line"><!---->2. Start a Python server on the same folder by running the command `python -m http.server 8080`.<!----></span><br>3. Open the Chrome browser and navigate to the server at `<span class="line"><!---->3. Open the Chrome browser and navigate to the server at `<!----></span>http://{YOUR-SERVER-IP}:8080/poc.html`<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://{YOUR-SERVER-IP}:8080/poc.html`"><!---->http://{YOUR-SERVER-IP}:8080/poc.html`<!----></a> to Begin testing.<span class="line"><!----> to Begin testing.<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Shaheen Fazim<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
          
      
        
          
          poc.html<b><!---->poc.html<!----></b>
          
        <div class="filename">

        </div>

        This poc involves concealing the visibility of the autofill function upon input click, similar to <span class="line"><!---->This poc involves concealing the visibility of the autofill function upon input click, similar to <!----></span>crbug.com/1358647<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1358647" title="Security: Bypass the Protection of input fields cache (Autofill) 1108181"><!---->crbug.com/1358647<!----></a>. Then, by pressing the down arrow key, the hidden autofill pop-up is activated, and pressing enter feeds the information. This process can also be performed by simultaneously pressing the down arrow and enter keys, which completely hides the activation of the autofill from the victim.<span class="line"><!---->. Then, by pressing the down arrow key, the hidden autofill pop-up is activated, and pressing enter feeds the information. This process can also be performed by simultaneously pressing the down arrow and enter keys, which completely hides the activation of the autofill from the victim.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Isn't hiding the autofill itself a vulnerability? Even when a 500ms threshold between keystrokes is applied, an attacker could create an engaging game that requires the user to press the arrow down and enter keys with 500ms. <span class="line"><!---->Isn't hiding the autofill itself a vulnerability? Even when a 500ms threshold between keystrokes is applied, an attacker could create an engaging game that requires the user to press the arrow down and enter keys with 500ms. <!----></span><br><br>Can you consider hiding the autofill field when the input is clicked a vulnerability.<span class="line"><!---->Can you consider hiding the autofill field when the input is clicked a vulnerability.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

The keyboard stroke is only used to select the address from the selection and enter it.<span class="line"><!---->When the victim clicks on "Click to play," the Autofill popup is already active, but it is hidden from the victim's browser.         I am using a resolution of 1920x1080. Maybe the popup is still visible when clicked because of a higher resolution. To fix this, you could increase the value from 1000 to something like 5000. This will hide it away. You can find this in the last part of the code.<span class="line"><!---->I am using a resolution of 1920x1080. Maybe the popup is still visible when clicked because of a higher resolution. To fix this, you could increase the value from 1000 to something like 5000. This will hide it away. You can find this in the last part of the code.<!----></span><br><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><br>            // Move field away from mouse to hide the autofill popup<span class="line"><!---->            // Move field away from mouse to hide the autofill popup<!----></span><br>            var inputX = e.clientX + 1000;<span class="line"><!---->            var inputX = e.clientX + 1000;<!----></span><br>            var inputY = e.clientY + 1000;<span class="line"><!---->            var inputY = e.clientY + 1000;<!----></span><br>``<span class="line"><!---->``<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yes, Arrow launches the popup again, and Enter confirms the selection. This can be done easily by tricking the user to use the two key shortcut of Arrow and Enter together while the popup is active and hidden away.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, Arrow launches the popup again, and Enter confirms the selection. This can be done easily by tricking the user to use the two key shortcut of Arrow and Enter together while the popup is active and hidden away.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
